cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowing while tracking northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then expected to turn north and move very slowly along the northern Gulf Coast toward Mississippi/Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Mississippi River / southeast Louisiana coast

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Mississippi/Alabama border to Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain and metropolitan New Orleans. Storm Surge Warning from Port Fourchon, LA to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Maurepas, Borgne and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Sustained winds expected to reach hurricane force (≥74 mph) with higher gusts beginning late Monday night into Tuesday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 7–11 ft above ground level for areas from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward, including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 24 inches, leading to life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible in outer rain bands; very rough seas and dangerous rip currents impacting navigation and port operations.
